title: How to Make Carrot Pudding

steps.headline: Blend or sift together the flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and allspice.
Stir in the raisins and currants.
steps.description: Combine well to coat the fruit. Set aside.

steps.headline: Cream together the butter or margarine and sugar in a separate bowl.
Dissolve the baking soda in the well-beaten egg.
steps.description: Gradually add to the creamed mixture.

steps.headline: Stir in the grated carrot, potato and soft breadcrumbs.
Add to the fruit mixture and combine thoroughly.
Turn batter into a well-greased 1-quart mould.
steps.description: Cover with aluminum foil and tie in place.

steps.headline: Steam for 2 1/2 hours, then uncover and place in a pre-heated 350ºF/180ºC oven for 10 minutes.
Re-cover and store in refrigerator.
steps.description: To reheat, steam for about 1 hour.

steps.headline: Serve hot, with lemon sauce or other suitable sauce.

text: Blend or sift together the flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and allspice.  Stir in the raisins and currants. Combine well to coat the fruit. Set aside. Cream together the butter or margarine and sugar in a separate bowl.  Dissolve the baking soda in the well-beaten egg. Gradually add to the creamed mixture. Stir in the grated carrot, potato and soft breadcrumbs.  Add to the fruit mixture and combine thoroughly.  Turn batter into a well-greased 1-quart mould. Cover with aluminum foil and tie in place. Steam for 2 1/2 hours, then uncover and place in a pre-heated 350ºF/180ºC oven for 10 minutes.  Re-cover and store in refrigerator. To reheat, steam for about 1 hour. Serve hot, with lemon sauce or other suitable sauce.
